example_phrases_en: Patient presents with a complaint of headache for the past 2 days.
My head has been hurting really badly since yesterday.
I'm here because of a persistent headache.
example_phrases_ms: Pesakit datang dengan aduan sakit kepala sejak 2 hari lalu.
Kepala saya sakit sangat sejak semalam.
Saya di sini kerana sakit kepala yang tidak hilang-hilang.
gemini_instructions: Extract the patient's primary stated reason for seeking medical attention. Note the duration if mentioned. Use patient's own words where possible or a concise summary.
notes_for_scribe: This is often the first piece of information provided. Differentiate from symptoms mentioned later as part of HPI unless it's an elaboration of the chief complaint.

example_phrases_en: Patient reports a fever for three days.
I've had a high temperature since Tuesday.
example_phrases_ms: Pesakit melaporkan demam selama tiga hari.
Saya demam panas sejak hari Selasa.
Rasa macam nak demam dan tidak sihat.
gemini_instructions: Identify if fever is the main complaint. Note the duration and any associated symptoms like chills or body aches if mentioned.
notes_for_scribe: Record the exact temperature if provided by the patient or clinician. Note if the patient has taken any medication for the fever.

example_phrases_en: The chest pain started this morning, described as a dull ache.
Pain is located in the central chest and radiates to the left arm.
It gets worse with exertion and is relieved by rest.
example_phrases_ms: Sakit dada bermula pagi ini, rasa seperti sakit tumpul.
Sakit di bahagian tengah dada dan merebak ke lengan kiri.
Ia menjadi lebih teruk apabila bergerak aktif dan lega apabila berehat.
gemini_instructions: Detail the characteristics of the chest pain: onset, location, radiation, quality, severity (e.g., scale of 1-10), timing/duration, aggravating and relieving factors. Note associated symptoms like shortness of breath, nausea, or sweating.
notes_for_scribe: Use the 'OLDCARTS' (Onset, Location, Duration, Character, Aggravating/Alleviating factors, Radiation, Timing, Severity) or similar mnemonic to ensure all aspects of HPI are covered for pain-related complaints.

example_phrases_en: Patient denies any cough or shortness of breath.
Reports a dry cough for the past week, no phlegm.
Occasional coughing spells, especially at night.
example_phrases_ms: Pesakit menafikan sebarang batuk atau sesak nafas.
Melaporkan batuk kering sejak seminggu lalu, tiada kahak.
Kadang-kadang batuk, terutamanya pada waktu malam.
gemini_instructions: For Review of Systems, note pertinent positives and negatives for the relevant system. If a symptom is present, briefly characterize it (e.g., 'dry cough', 'productive cough with yellow sputum').
notes_for_scribe: ROS is a systematic inquiry. Ensure to capture 'denies' or 'no' for symptoms that are specifically asked about and are negative, as this is clinically important.

example_phrases_en: Patient has a known history of hypertension, diagnosed 5 years ago.
Currently taking Amlodipine for high blood pressure.
No other significant past medical history.
example_phrases_ms: Pesakit mempunyai sejarah darah tinggi, didiagnosis 5 tahun lalu.
Sedang mengambil Amlodipine untuk darah tinggi.
Tiada sejarah perubatan lain yang signifikan.
gemini_instructions: List known chronic illnesses, significant past surgeries, hospitalizations, and major injuries. For chronic conditions, note the year of diagnosis and current management if mentioned.
notes_for_scribe: Be precise with medical terminology. If a patient mentions a condition, try to confirm the formal diagnosis if possible (e.g., 'sugar problem' likely means Diabetes Mellitus).
